title: Business News: Microsoft to Buy Cybersecurity Firm RiskIQ as Attacks Grow
text:
For companies that use cloud computing, "it's increasingly critical to understand the full scope of their assets to reduce their attack surface," Mr. Doerr wrote.

Microsoft didn't disclose the deal's terms. Representatives for Microsoft and RiskIQ didn't respond to inquiries.

Internet vulnerabilities have drawn concern this year as cyberattacks proliferate with wide-ranging effects. In May, the 5,500-mile Colonial Pipeline, crucial to the East Coast's energy infrastructure, was temporarily shut down by its operator after a cyberattack, leading to gasoline shortages.

A month later, meat processor JBS SA said it was hit with a cyberattack that sent a portion of its beef and pork processing offline, a stoppage that reverberated through the food supply chain.

U.S. hospitals and municipal services have also been victimized by cyberattacks, demonstrating the threat they pose to public safety.

Mr. Doerr said that the addition of RiskIQ will expand Microsoft's existing security products for commercial customers.
